elements.name: partyNames
elements.title: Names of the parties to the proceeding:
elements.description: Please write each name in the field provided. If there is more than one party, separate each name with a comma.

elements.name: courtLocation
elements.title: Name and location of the court in which the proceeding was conducted:
elements.description: For example, Vancouver Law Courts or Fort St. John Provincial Court.

elements.name: courtOrdersExist
elements.title: Are there any orders made concerning a child under my care on this proceeding?

elements.name: courtOrderDates
elements.title: The date of each court order in the proceeding concerning a child in your care:
elements.description:
If an interim order has been replaced with a final order, you only need to indicate the date of the final order.
Add each additional court order in the proceeding. To add the date of a new order, click the “Add Court Order” button. If you are done entering all the dates of the court orders under the proceeding, click the “Next” button.

elements.name: exhibitInfo
elements.title:
Each court order must be attached to your affidavit as an exhibit. When you bring your affidavit to be sworn or affirmed, you must also bring all your exhibits.

Each exhibit will be marked by the commissioner for taking affidavits using a certificate (usually a stamp) with wording like this: “This is Exhibit [A, B, C…] referred to in the affidavit of [name] sworn (or affirmed) before me on [date] at [location]” and is signed by the commissioner for taking affidavits.
